page.title: 05Kington's schools history
page.content: Lady Hawkins'School was founded under the will dated 1619 of Dame Margaret Hawkins,whose portrait is in the school entrance,wife of the famous Sir John Hawkins. The school was opened on September 29th 1632. Girls were not allowed to go to the school until September 26th 1907. The school was built by John Abel, "The King's Carpenter" who built many buildings in the Herefordshire market towns. There used to be some antique Latin books in the school. They have recently been donated to Hereford Cathedral Library. The school was a grammer school but has now changed to a comprehansive. It caters for people aged 11-18. There have been many schools in Kington including the Charity School, National School, Elementary School and the Primary School, the former being the only one of these still running.
